keyTakeAways: Brandy left stage unexpectedly during a Chicago performance of the joint tour with Monica, causing audience confusion and disappointment.
Brandy apologized for the abrupt exit, citing dehydration and feeling unwell during rehearsals, and stated she made an effort to return despite not feeling well.
The tour, named after their 1998 duet 'The Boy Is Mine,' did not include the performance of that hit song, which sparked public concern and speculation about the tour’s purpose.
Brandy praised Monica for stepping in gracefully and the crew for their support, and confirmed she went to a doctor after the incident.
Brandy emphasized that the tour was about more than rivalry — it was about unity, shared stories, and global connection through music.

There has been long-standing speculation about tensions between Brandy and Monica, though Brandy clarified that the tour was meant to represent a powerful bond between two women and their shared journey.

summaryOfNewsArticle: During a Chicago stop of their joint 'The Boy Is Mine Tour,' Brandy unexpectedly left the stage, leaving Monica to finish the performance solo. The incident sparked public confusion and disappointment, especially since the tour was named after their iconic 1998 duet, which was not performed. In a statement, Brandy apologized, explaining she experienced dehydration and a desire to faint after weeks of rehearsals, and prioritized her health. She praised Monica’s professionalism and the crew’s support, noting she went to a doctor afterward. Brandy emphasized that the tour was about unity and shared stories, not rivalry, highlighting the deeper emotional significance of their collaboration.
title: Brandy Explains Why She Left Monica All Alone on Stage
